meanings.definition: Capable of being justified or defended.
meanings.sent1: The decision to help the injured puppy was vindicable.
meanings.sent2: Her vindicable actions in the face of danger earned her respect.
meanings.sent3: It was quite vindicable when the cat tried to chase its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's vindicable explanation made the complex topic easier to understand.
meanings.sent5: The hero's vindicable bravery inspired others to act courageously.

meanings.definition: Able to be proven correct or valid.
meanings.sent1: The scientist provided vindicable evidence to support his theory.
meanings.sent2: Her vindicable argument convinced everyone of her innocence.
meanings.sent3: It seemed almost vindicable when the robot solved the puzzle in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The map was a vindicable guide through the maze of streets.
meanings.sent5: The witness's vindicable testimony cleared the confusion surrounding the case.
